questions.question: Work on the new bridge will begin as soon as an official mandate ………………………….
questions.description: When both clauses refer to the future, we use a future tense in the main clause and a present tense in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: Attendance at Sunday chapel is ……………………… longer mandatory for students.
questions.description: No longer means the same as not any longer.

questions.question: The dog’s leg ………………………… in the accident.
questions.description: We need a passive verb here because the subject is not the doer of the action.

questions.question: Is ………………………… in danger of extinction?
questions.description: No article is used with it.

questions.question: The ship’s ………………………….. being overhauled.
questions.description: Machinery does not have a plural form.

questions.question: The two sisters are mad ………………………… tennis.
questions.description: When you are mad about something you are infatuated with it.

questions.question: I am mad ………………………… him.
questions.description: When mad means angry it is used with at.

questions.question: Can you tell us how …………………………….?
questions.description: Indirect questions have the normal word order. That means the subject goes before the auxiliary verb.

questions.question: You can’t make me …………………………….
questions.description: Make is followed by object + infinitive without to.

questions.question: He has an annoying ………………………… of scratching his head while talking.
questions.description: A mannerism is a peculiar action or habitual gesture.
